1.content:
In the middle of the night, a bright flash suddenly engulfed the world and everybody on earth shrunk down to mere inches.
Now, they are desperately trying to adapt to this new, gargantuan world. But it has only been hours - most people cower in their homes, waiting for salvation. Some are convinced, that this is a dream and they only have to wait until they wake up to their normal lives. Some haven't even noticed, still sleeping in their beds, oblivious to their new lifes. And only very few have ventured out to find help. Somewhere out there had to be someone still at their original size. Someone, who could help.

And they are right. Someone has only just woken up - completely their normal self. The only strange thing they note, as they get ready for the day, is the extraordinary quiet street. Normally, the noise of cars and trucks going by wakes them up way earlier.
Washing their face is the last thing they do before they dress themsleves, ready to tackle their work. A final look in the mirror shows:


July Hall:
July is a college student, studying english literature. Despite the stuffy subject, she has always been known as a party girl, much to the chagrin of her roommates. Even more annoying to them were her constant dates which she always brought home for a night or two - quickly forgetting most of them. It was easy for her. She had looks most other girls would kill for. Long, blond hair falls down towards her slim waist, and her shirts always look a little too tight for her chest.
July is outgoing and friendly, though she does have a knack for drunken mischief. She likes pranking her roommates or even introducing herself to new people with one.

Nadja Price:
Nadja is a friendly, but shy woman. She has always been known to be kind of a nerd, something that her shelf full of comicbooks doesn't exactly disprove. While other people go out, she likes to stay in with her computer or watch the latest blockbuster. Which is a shame - cause she would be a hit with the men. Her butt seems to have a magnetizing power, drawing looks everywhere she goes.
Though she might seem kind of aloof and beyond reproach, the people close to her know better. Nadja is probably the kindest woman you could ever meet. She's always ready to help someone out. She loves to take care of pets - which is why she studied to become a veterinarian.

Lee June:
During the day, Lee works customer service for a tech company. Of course, she hates the job, just barely less than the callers. But recently, she has found a profitable way to relieve some stress. To supplement her income, she streams very adult material of herself to a camsite. In only a short amount of time, she has become one of the most viewed streamers on the site - not least because of her enormous curves. Her breasts are gigantic, as is her butt. She gets daily messages from 'fans', begging her to smother them. She quite likes the attention.
Despite her occupation, she is mostly a reserved and quiet woman, and very helpful once you get to know her. Though the stress of her dayjob is getting to her. And the usual relief isn't quite cutting it, anymore...

Roxanne Watkins:
Roxanne is a rich girl. THE rich girl. Her parents passed away a while ago - not that she cared much - leaving her with the wealth of multiple generations, all for herself. She never had to work a day in her life. But despite the stereotype, she was smarter than anyone else in her class. She coasted through school and then through college, getting a degree in physics and mathematics without much difficulty. Not in need for a job, she spends her days either at her enormous townhouse or one of her many apartments, scattered throughout the worlds largest cities.
Sadly it seems like her wealth has replaced her empathy. She barely related to any of her classmates, viewing them as beneath her. Sometimes, she was outright cruel if she wasn't left alone. Not even boys interested her all that much - though she wasn't lacking attention on their part. She simply didn't want someone talking back at her...

11.content:
July's head was still pounding. Maybe she overdid it last night - or rather, the last few days.She moaned, while she brushed her teeth. The afternoon sun was just way to bright for her right now...

It was summer, and college was on break. Finally! Though July loved reading, she rarely found time for it during vacation. Because that was the time to live out her wild side! July always knew about the biggest events in the city and almost every evening, she went to a bar, a club, or a festival, partying until the sun was rising. The days she spent sleeping off her stupor, before she readied herself again for the next party. Her roommates, Jessie and Sandra couldn't grasp, how much energy she had. Sometimes it seemed, like all she needed to survive was a wild dance, an even wilder drink, and, of course, a date for the night. Though her roommates were by no means prudes, they sometimes got annoyed at July's libido - particularly when it got in the way of her other plans. Though it didn't happen as often anymore, there were still occasions where July would abandon plans she made to visit one of her 'boys', as Jessie called them.

Slowly, and after a few glasses of water, July's hangover abated somewhat. To greet the summer sun, she had put on her usual outfit: A thin, black crop top, only secured by very thin strings. Her midriff was free - she wanted to feel the sun on as much of her skin as possible. For the same reason, she had decided on denim shorts, which didn't cover much of her legs, and light, brown sandals.
She sat down in the small kitchen of her apartment, eating a light breakfast. College would soon be picking up again, so she thought about how she wanted to spend her remaining free time. As far as she knew, there wasn't a party worth going to, today. But there were other things she could do.

The first thing on her mind was, of course, to get someone to keep her company. She rarely stayed in contact with her dates. She didn't have to. With her figure, it was easy enough to find someone willing to give her a good time. There was a bar she had been met with lots of success, recently - maybe she could find someone there. Plus, the bartender was cute as well.

Another thing popped into her mind. She had barely noticed the lack of noise when she woke up, but now the odd quietness piqued her curiosity. Not just, that the usually busy city seemed all but deserted - her roommates as well were uncharacteristically silent. Normally, Sandra would blast her music at this time, while Jessie would try to outmatch her in the volume departemnt with the Television. Maybe she could see, what was up with them?

She could also just spend the day at the mall. She rarely went on a shopping spree, but she didn't have anything planned for today - and it had been a while since she ate something more substantial than noodles. Her cooking skills weren't exactly refined, which made her all the more eager to hit up the food court and shop around for anything that might catch her eye.

Though, as much as she would like to do something fun today, she couldn't ignore college forever. In just a week she would have to attend lectures again. She didn't hate her studies - but she wasn't looking forward to her free time going up in smoke as she'd get smothered by assignments. Maybe, she should start preparing. If she put the work in now, the first few weeks would be so much easier.

While July thought over her options, she was completely unaware of how much the world had changed in the last few hours. No matter how she chose to spend the day - it was only a matter of time until she discovered the shrunken inhabitants of this new world. The only question now, was where would discover them - and how she would react.

111.content:
As July thought about all her options, she decided that she should prepare for the night. Or at least get someone for the night. Given her body she wasn't going to have a problem with that. Even at a time like this in the morning, there would be a lot of guys that would love to get with her.

July smiled as she got up, walked to the mirror and looked over herself “Hm... yeah good enough” She said giving herself a check. She'd done this before, a lot of times before so she knew what was needed to get a guy to by her a drink.

As she walked some more, she grabbed her keys and headed for the door “Girls! Im going out to the bar! Have fun... being quiet i guess!” July said as she didn't understand that part. It was odd, but then again they could simply not be home.

July opened the door and walked out, which was a problem

“No! Don't leave!”

“Fuck please come back July!”
 These voices were unheard, as July simply left the room and went off to the bar. Sandra and Jessie were freaking out, eventually getting together. When July came in normal sized the girls, although scared, had tried to get her attention.

Making it perfectly clear how difficult that would be, given their difference in size.

-

As July got out she looked around the place, not seeing a single person. Really odd, in fact confusion in general. It was almost like there had been a rapture, and she got left behind.

Which did make a bit of sense, July thought, giggling to herself. She simply shrugged as she went to her car, got on and started to drive. Both Sandra’s and Jessie’s cars were home. It seemed, they were just having a long sleep.
 July didn't mind that much as she started to drive. Going onto the road and as she expected... it was empty. Beside her's, there was not a single other moving car. Granted, there were cars in the streets, annoyingly parked in her way. But they weren't moving either.

“Okay, this is fucking weird,” she said to herself as she tried to distract herself from the freakiness. Turning on the Radio, she expected to hear her favourite channel. As she turned it on though, not a single voice came through.

“What the hell is going on?” she said as she drove through town, not seeing a single person. Maybe a Rapture did happen. It would make more sense then this, just empty streets. She did see animals, though. Birds swooping down and grabbing something that she couldn't really see. She assumed it was a bug or something.

So of course she kept driving, not paying attention. If she did, she would have seen a poor lady getting attacked and eventually eaten by the pigeons.

As July pulled up to the bar, she shrugged off the weirdness. She was planning on flirting with a cute man in there. Truth be told the one she really wanted was Derrick, the Bartender.

He worked night shifts though, so he probably wouldn't be in there. He was the one guy who July couldn't seem to get. No matter the flirting, no matter the skimpy dresses she wore, no matter what.

Which of course made her want him even more. He was around her age, with dark skin and a short cut. Damn if he didn't look good in his clothes, though. There were plenty of reasons, why July was desiring him. But of course it wouldn't happen, so she went home with a different guy, most nights.

As she walked in, she looked around the place. Taking a look at the sign as she had to double check. The place said 'open', but no one was around her. In fact it was as empty as the whole town.

“Figures. Hey! Anyone here!” She said as she looked around.

All the drunks and workers that had been in there all night, saw the giant blonde enter! Needless to say the sight was enough to make most of the men amazed! The sight was gorgeous, and the little girls that were in the bar last night had nothing on her.

Some were already screaming up to her, desperate for her to hear them. They didn't know that July was still a little out of it and her hearing really hadn't fully recovered.

Which was a real problem as she walked even closer. Taking steps and waiting for any words. Everyone started to run from her, screaming as they didn't want to get stepped on.

Being only a couple of inches tall, they were nothing compared to this girl. Luckily no one really got stepped on, as they had plenty of time to run as July just thought to herself.

She could try to assume it was a coincidence, but as it kept happening it was clear that something happened. Maybe a rapture, maybe everybody had just moved. Maybe she was dreaming.

Regardless there was one thing she knew. “Open Bar!!” She cheered with arms up. A smile on her face, she moved over, walking across the bar and onto the other side.

She danced around, happily ready to not only take some bottles but maybe even pour herself one right now. She knew it wasn't right to steal, and normally she wouldn't, but at the same time she was having fun. And no one was here to stop her.

Plus, after the mess of this morning she could use a drink. She headed out and grabbed a glass and some bottles, placing them onto the empty counter. It still had some drinks on it, only adding to the weirdest.
 As she was about to start pouring a bottle, she paused, looking down to the stool on this side.

The one she usually spotted Derrick sitting at. She paused as she saw something on it. Leaning down at it, and brushing some hair out of her face, she tried to see what it really was.

As she got closer and got a better look, July saw that it was ______________

1111.content:
July

“Woah, what a weird looking bug,” July said as she started to down her drink. She watched in amusement as the strange, white bug repeatedly jumped up and down on the stool. “Ahh, is the little guy trying to get my attention?” July cooed at it with a smile, her drunken mind coming up with a fun little idea. “Tell you what. Normally I like my men big, strong and handsome but since I am getting free drinks anyway how about I give you a little lap-dance to celebrate?” She faux-asked as he gave her big booty a slap before pouring herself a second drink.

The bug started jumping faster and July could have sworn that it was actually waving at her… hell, she even thought she heard a squeak from the bug.

“Here I come little guy!” July spoke out, new drink in hand, as she took a few steps towards the stool.

The bug wasn’t jumping anymore, instead it was slowly backing away, not realizing that it was heading toward the middle of the seat. Then suddenly, it fell backwards as its foot got caught in one of the rips on the stool’s cushions, leaving it sprawled out in the middle of the seat.

“Looks like somebody’s eager!” July sang out as she turned around and plopped down onto the stool. She then began to rock back and forth and even bounced a few times before getting bored and downing her second drink.

July looked around at the empty bar and released a sigh. It just wasn’t that fun when no one else was there.

“Maybe I’ll go have walk in the park or go to the pool, it’s a nice sunny day after all. I should enjoy it.”

Derrick

It had started out as a normal night at the bar, a dozen or so patrons either drinking or dancing.

Then there was a flash of light and a wave of nausea went through him and every other person in the bar. He sat down on his stool… and then he found himself trapped, at the minuscule size of one inch, on the same chair he sat on every night.

He had tried calling out for help but soon realized that it was pointless. He saw other people, also shrunk, on the ground far below and realized that no one would be able to help him. His only options were to either jump to his death to the tiled floor below or wait on his stool for starvation or dehydration to eventually kill him.

Several hours of looking at the clock, sleeping, waking up, pissing off the side of the stool, and once more looking at the clock later and Derrick was starting to think that maybe jumping wouldn’t be such a bad way to go.

Then he heard the door to the bar opening and a surge of hope rushed through him. Somebody who wasn’t shrunk had entered the bar!

“Hey! Anyone here!”

Derrick collapsed as the massive voice yelled out. Quickly standing back up he got ready to try and grab the attention of whoever might be there.

Hopefully they would come to the workers side of the bar.

“Open Bar!!” the voice cried out again but this time Derrick was ready and didn’t fall over.

Instead he was stunned when a beautiful titaness of epic proportions started to dance her way into the back, unknowingly trampling a patron on the ground, and started to grab herself drinks.

And then by chance she looked his way! Derrick immediately tried to get her attention by jumping up and down and waving with all his might.

And his efforts were rewarded as the Titaness peered closer at him with a look of wonder on her face.

“Woah, what a weird looking bug,” The woman said before turning back to her drink.

Slightly disheartened at her reply Derrick continued to try and get her attention. Because if he didn’t, he would likely die.

“Ahh, is this little guy trying to get my attention?” The woman cooed at him, which was only a small blow to his ego, but at least she was still talking to…

“Tell you what. Normally I like my men big, strong and handsome but since I am getting free drinks anyway how about I give you a little lap-dance to celebrate?” The women teased as she gave her own giant ass a slap, before turning back to grab a second drink.

Derrick’s blood froze for just a moment as a sense of dread went through him.

Now he was shouting toward the giantess, hoping that maybe she might actually hear him or something.

“Here I come little guy.” She called out as she started to come closer.

Derrick tried to back up, where to he had no idea but maybe if he was on the edge of the stool, he would be able to dodge the woman’s ass if he was lucky.

He wasn’t lucky. Instead he tripped on one of the small rips on the stool’s cushion and ended up sprawled out right in the middle, the absolute worse place to be.

“Looks like somebody’s eager!”

Derrick lifted up his hands as if to hold up the descending moon.

His arms snapped like twigs as the giantess sat down.

Derrick screamed from underneath her denim shorts, the unbearable pressure slowly crushing him.

Then she started to rock back and forth. In one moment the crushing weight would release its grip on him only to return the next with even greater force.

Derrick felt his legs snap but he couldn’t scream. All the air had been forced out of his lungs by the woman's 'lap-dance'. He couldn't even make a sound. The only thing keeping him up was the sheer amount of pain he was in.

Then, the Titaness started to bounce up and down on the stool. Each time he would watch the ass rise up only for it to fall right back down.

And each time it fell Derrick felt one of his ribs break from the blow.

Finally, the women stopped, her cruel fun over. Instead she simply sat on him, letting her own great weight slowly snuff out his life.

But before he could pass on the ass once more rose up but this time it didn’t come back down. Instead the woman walked away, leaving the poor, broken bartender to suffer on his own work cushion.

11112.content:
July shot a few of her friends a message if they wanted to hang out, but she didn't receive any responses. Frowning, she wondered what was up with everyone. First a completely deserted bar, now all of her friends didn't answer her. Her roommates were nowhere to be seen.
And the streets were just empty. Just what was going on?

As quickly as her curiosity was peaked, it vanished again. Who cared where everyone was. It was probably just something ordinary, like a big football game happening in the area. This place always became a ghost town as soon as a sports team was in the mere vicinity. Which meant only one thing to July:
She could have the pool all to herself!

Grinning, she went to her car, snatched out her bikini and towel - she kept an "emergency beach kit" in her car at all times - and strolled through the empty streets towards the public bath!
She was barely surprised when no one greeted her, though it was odd, that there wasn't even a guy on the register. Still, the entrance was wide open.
It took five minutes for July to tire of waiting for the guy. If there was no one here, she didn't have to pay, either, she thought to herself. If they had a problem with that, they could just tell her later.

July headed for the changing room, quickly slipping into her bikini. It had been a gift from one of her one-week boyfriends, but she loved it nonetheless. It was bright yellow and very skimpy. More than once, some old hag had yelled at her to dress more modest when she was here. But it was easy to ignore her, simply because it drew the looks of countless men and women who couldn't help but check her out.

Taking her clothes with her, she finally entered the pool and was greeted by - absolutely no one. She simply shrugged. July had thought there would be at least a couple of people here. At least, she was expecting a lifeguard. But apparently no one could be bothered to show up today.
But now she couldn't ignore that something strange was going on anymore. Furrowing her brow, she went over to the small restaurant right next to the large field of grass, where the guests would usually relax. No one was in the kitchen.

The mischievous part of July took over once more. If the whole staff had decided to leave the pool unattended, it was only fair to assume that they wouldn't mind her serving herself.
July grinned wildly. This might be the perfect way for the pool to be: completely empty and completely free! Spending the day here sounded more and more fun by the second.
She lay down the bunched up pile of her clothes next to a lounger and excitedly strolled towards the pool.

Of course, she didn't notice any of the countless tiny people desperately trying to get her attention. Some of them were running towards the enormous girl, only to be pulverized underneath her bare feet. Others were more clever, trying to get up on to the lounger. Surely she would see them, once she came back.
But their hopes were dashed. July played in the water for some time and after swimming some laps, she returned to her lounger. The minuscule people jumped and waved up at her - only to be met by her enormous body bathing them in shadow as she lied down. For a moment, July thought something tickled her belly, but the feeling vanished just as quick as it came. She didn't notice how her weight snuffed out multiple lives underneath her.
July spend the next hour simply enjoying the sun. She didn't care anymore where everybody went. This was awesome!

Soon though, her stomach rumbled. The drinks from the bar had only been a temporary solution for her first, as well. Thankfully, the restaurant had remained unattended. And as no one was there to stop her, July got up to get herself some food!

12.content:
Nadja blinked blearily. She could see nothing in the darkness. She always kept the shutters down, not so much because she preferred the dark, but more to muffle the sounds of busy road next to her apartment at least somewhat. For once, it seemed to have worked. Not a single noise penetrated into her room. She smiled a tired smile and let her head hit the pillow again. It wasn't busy - no, it was dead silent. Unusal, but welcome.
She felt around her bed. Somewhere in the countless folds of her massive blanket, she found her phone. Usually, she spent her nights browsing her favourite sites - videostreams and wikis of her favourite games, sometimes tech forums - until she fell asleep and simply dropped it into her sheets. It took her five minutes to find it - a new record for her. She brought the phone infront of her face, eager to see if that ass on youtube had ever replied to her snarks about him. But when she pressed the switch to start it up, a whole other thing came to her attention.

"It's nine already!? she shrieked, throwing her blanket off of herself. Quickly, she rushed out of her room and into the bath! She had to get ready! It was, after all, a big day for her!
Putting on some tight, black leggins, a cute, colourful T-shirt, a rocking, red skirt and her favourite pair of pink sneakers, she was ready to face the day. She had many things to do!

First, she had a date lined up - the first in ages! She wasn't usually all that active, romanitcally, especially not outside. She found it difficult to start a conversation with a stranger, no matter how nice. It was more a 'her'-problem than a simple 'hadn't-found-the-right-guy-yet'-problem. Sometimes, when she was feeling adventurous, she would load up a dating- or hook-up app, just to see if anybody was interested. But even if the answer was yes - which it was almost all the time - she quickly lost interest again, content to stay in and reread some comics.
But now, she had finally agreed to meet someone! Her name was Andrea (so elegant!), and she would meet her in the mall! Going shopping sounded fun! Maybe she could show her her favourite place - the arcade!

Another thing that she had to do today was picking up a package. Nadja had ordered some parts from a computer store nearby. As well as she liked her old computer, she couldn't deny that it was getting a bit old. The hardware was worn out - and she didn't want her harddrive to die on her, again - so she had ordered almost everything she needed, of the highest quality, of course. She had the money to spare. The only thing she'd keep, was the deep blue tower casing with white stripes on it. It had been a gift from one of her best friends, Violet. It had cased the first computer she'd ever owned - and continued to do so for every new one she bought.
But going to the store would be a chore. Most of the staff was nice enough, but the guy who handled packages was just absolutely leacherous. Everytime she entered, she could feel his sticky gaze linger on her backside. He had taken quite an interest in her, it seemed, though he hadn't even bothered to ask her her name. To be fair, neither had she. She just wanted as little to do with him as possible.

As she thought of Violet, another thing came into her mind. She hadn't visited her friend in a while, both of them simply being to busy most of the time, nowadays. Violet worked as a consultant for a law firm - and the only reason she wasn't boss of it yet was, that the guy in charge, a slimy prick called Marvin, was apparently very bothered by her professionalism. His mind seemed stuck in the fifties, despite him being quite young, actually. There was hardly a day now, where Violet wouldn't post and angry rant about him on social media. Through her posts, and a couple of drunk conversations at girl's night, Nadja had become quite pissed off at him.
But today, Violet probably wouldn't be at the firm. Nadja knew for a fact, that she had taken the day aside - because Violet's birthday was today! A surprise visit would certainly be nice!

Also, Nadja would have to check into the clinic, sometime, just to see if the new guys there had everything under control. They didn't have any acute cases right now, but emergencies could happen and she just wanted to be sure, that they were doing alright.
There was another reason to her visit as well. One of the newest guys on her team was Jack, fresh out of college and an absolute hunk. Though she already had a date, she wouldn't mind having him as a back-up. He was just nice to look at with his short, blonde hair, his hunky chest, his tight shirts...
Nadja caught herself before she drifted into a day dream.

She had a big day ahead of her, and would tackle these things one at a time. Thankfully, she wasn't bound to a tight schedule (anymore). So she could choose, what to do first!

123.content:
Well at the moment, Nadja maybe wanted to go over to her friend's place. Not only because it was her birthday and she wanted to see Violet, but because she had a date later on and... well she wasn’t exactly savy when it came to clothes.

Nadja's usual outfit was a combination of comfy jeans, worn sneakers and one of her many pop culture shirts. Violet would definitely be able to help. Thinking for a little bit, she considered getting her a gift at the mall, but figured that money would be enough. They didn’t really have the same interests.

Once dressed, she walked right through the door and got out. Her garage was tiny and she barely had enough room to reach her small car. She wasn’t one to really care about expensive cars, not that she could really afford one anyway.

She drove off, going to her friend’s house. The road looking a bit interesting.

-

As Nadja got out of the car, she knocked a couple of times on her friend’s door. She knew Violet was home, her car parked in her large driveway, but she didn’t get a response.

“Hey uh... Violet! It’s me Nadja! Happy birthday!” She said, trying to get her friend to open the door. However there was no response, which got her a bit worried. Violet had always been one to wake up early, almost annoyingly early. It was usually for a run or something.

So right now, she Nadja was concerned. Jumping to conclusions like she usually did, she went and got the spare key Violet had hidden for her in the case of an emergency. It was right in the flowerpot where it should be.

She opened the door and peered inside. No lights were on, but it didn’t look like there had been a struggle. So no intruder.

Maybe she was in her bed?

“Hey Violet! I am here!” She said, taking several steps towards her friends bedroom. Something bugged Nadja as she looked inside. Then she noticed: The bed was made almost perfect! Something that Violet absolutely refused to do.

“Hey, Violet where are you?” She said taking a couple of steps in. “I got cash for your birthday, and I need your help with a date.”

As she turned, she moved and sat down at the foot of the bed. A look of disappointment on her face as she lowered her ass. Her jeans, although baggie didn’t hide her ass at all.

She sat down, and pulled out her phone, punching in Violet's number. Again, she got no response which was easily explained. Violet's cheery ringtone sounded from one of her nightstand drawers. She had forgotten it again.

“Should have known,” Nadja sighed.

She hung up the phone and was a little bit unsure of what she was going to do now, when suddenly she felt something. Right under her butt, something was shifting! Despite it being under her blanket - as well as her butt - she could still feel it poking into her behind.

“Whaa!” She freaked out, jumping up and onto her feet, though she calmed down soon enough as she thought about it some more.
“A bug?” she asked herself. Violet’s home would be the last place a bug should be, but what other explanation was there?

Now as a Veterinarian she loved all types of animals and this also went for bugs. Now some might argue they weren’t animals but Nadja still cared for them. When she was young, she even had an ant nest.

So either the whole world had gotten something wrong about a fundamental law of nature, or this wasn't caused by anything natural. Her thoughts drifted and something else entered her mind. The strange quiet this morning. She lived next to a busy street leading into the city center. The sounds could be measured from annoying to deafening - but quiet was an absolute outlier. In all the time she had lived there, the street had always been source of noise.

Violet jumped backwards, startled by Nadja's spoon suddenly dropping onto the table. Looking up, she saw the shocked look on Nadja's face.
"Hey, what happened? Are you okay?" she asked, worried.
"I'm... not sure," Nadja answered, slowly stammering out the words. She looked at her tiny friend.
"I just have a bad feeling, because... well, you're the first person I'm seeing today."

Himako’s mouth snapped shut at that.

“Now if you excuse me everyone, paradise awaits.” Edward said as he started walking towards the giant Lee.

Cullen’s own mouth stood agape for a while longer before he could shake himself out of it. Looking at the two women before him he knew that it was his job to make the best possible choice for their continued survival.

Eventually he decided to follow…

1. Susan’s Plan: Sad to say but the relationship between Lee and himself wasn’t the best and she had more then enough reason to dislike him. Best to wait for the next normal sized person to come. Lee couldn’t be the ONLY person left unshrunk after all.

2. Himako’s Plan: It was well thought out and while it might take awhile it had a great chance at working. Worse comes to worse they could use the plan on the next giant to enter the building. Lee couldn’t be the ONLY person left unshrunk after all.

3. Edward’s Plan: Cullen.exe has crashed, only man-in-giant-pussy.jpg is available.
1312.title: To Get Her Attention

choices: Lee looking at them. she has noticed the sign. But has she noticed them?
Lee getting up, finished with her work. And she's walking straight at them!
Edward, caught inbetween Lee's toes. Will they help? Or leave him to his demise?
13122.content:
Edward's stupid grin snapped Cullen back to reality. The idiot was going to get himself killed! And for what, a look between the legs of one of his coworkers? He shook his head. Many women had already complained about him being a creep, but Cullen had always brushed them of. He didn't want to 'fix a running system', so to speak. But Edward being this brazen right in front of him almost made him want to punch him.

"Get back here right this instant, Edward!" he barked, his voice swelling to his usual commanding tone. While Himako and Susan both flinched, Edward simply turned back, his lecherous grin still solidly plastered to his face.
"What boss, are you really gonna just stand around here and let this chance go to waste? We all know you're just keeping her here because of her looks, so you can't blame me for following your example."
Cullen's face grew red with anger. "If you want to get yourself killed just to get yourself off, be my guest - but do it after we have established contact. I swear, if you ruin our opportunity to get help, I'll personally follow you into hell and knock you're fucking spark out."
"You really think you can scare me boss? With everything that's happening? Get real, it's only a matter of time until we die. Hell, I'm glad we haven't met a spider yet. So I'm choosing to go out with a bang. You can stay here and beg that whore for help if you want to, but I'm gonna get myself some of her..."
Edward wasn't able to finish his sentence before Cullen had closed the distance between them and decked him directly in the face. He collapsed like a sack of potatoes.

"When he wakes up, I'm gonna fire him," Cullen declared to no one in particular. Not that it meant anything anymore. Sighing, he turned around to Himako.
"You're right," he said, massaging his bruised knuckles, "we need to get Lee's attention and your plan could at least work in theory. So, where are those papers again?"
Himako hesitated for a moment, still stunned by her boss' sudden display of violence. "They should still be in my cubicle, sir. But Edward was right, it's probably gonna take us a while to get there."
"Then let's not loose any more time twiddling our thumbs," Cullen grunted and started to march forward.
"Are we really doing this?" Susan complained, "Why can't we just stay away from her? Haven't you seen what she has already done? She'll just trample us like she did Steven!"
"And what are you suggesting? Just stay here until the rodents get in?" Cullen barked back.

Susan mumbled something unintelligible, but eventually she trailed behind her remaining coworkers. Meanwhile, Himako struggled to keep up with Cullen's long, striding steps, having to jog behind him.
"What are we going to do with Edward? We can't just leave him here! What if Lee... you know, gets up?"
"His fault," Cullen grumbled, "but he shouldn't stay knocked out for long, so he's got ample chance to get to safety. Or get himself killed trying to climb her. I'm fine with both, personally."
Himako was shocked. Sure, Edward was a creep and not even a good worker. Genuinely, he might have been the worst person she ever had the displeasure to meet. But she couldn't wish death upon him.
"Shouldn't we at least try to convince him?" Himako asked timidly.
"My fist already did the talking. Now its up to him to make good decisions."

Himako fell silent. It was obvious that Cullen still saw himself in charge, something that she didn't think about until now. But his bullheadedness wouldn't be helpful. He had been mild by saying his relationship with Lee 'wasn't the best'. Even though she and Lee had kinda stopped talking, they still caught up with each other every now and then, and Cullen was a common topic of conversation between the two. To say that Lee hated his guts was an understatement.
And Himako knew, as soon as they had made contact with her, Cullen would start ordering Lee around like always. He was the kind of person that couldn't bear any hit to his ego. Usually, this was just annoying but with their reduced size it became downright dangerous. Himako didn't want to be caught between a stupid man and an angry giantess. She knew which side she wanted to be on in that case.

The three of them didn't talk much as they made their way towards Himako's cubicle. Cullen was still grumbling angrily, cursing Edward and the whole situation. Susan was silently fuming. It was obvious she wanted to do anything else, but she also didn't want to be alone.
Himako meanwhile thought about how she could get Lee to even help them. Himako had a chance, at least. Maybe their time at school together counted for something. But she couldn't see Lee helping anyone else in this office. She hated this job and probably everybody working with her as well. A pit formed in Himako's stomach. She would have to be very convincing to get Lee on to their side.

Finally, they reached the place where Himako had shrunk and, just as she said, papers were scattered all over the floor. Thankfully, she had been carrying a couple of pens as well.
"Okay, we need to write a message on there," she said. She walked to the nearest pen. Cullen and Susan followed.
It took them quite a while to just write the simple word "HELP!" at a size that would be readable for Lee. Wielding a pen that was twice your own size wasn't an easy task.

And now, they also had to walk all the way back again, this time dragging the large paper behind them. It was surprisingly exhausting. The carpeted floor didn't help, either. They had to keep pushing the thick strands of fiber out of their way to even keep walking.
But after two hours of dragging the enormous sheet, they finally arrived at Lee's desk again. Thankfully, she was still sat there. She was obviously bored, but still punching away on her keyboard. Himako raised an eyebrow. Were there still customer tickets coming in? She hadn't heard a single phone ring in all the time she had been shrunken. But maybe there was hope after all. Hope, that more people were still normal sized.

As they got closer, Himako was the first to notice that Edward wasn't there anymore. Only a small splatter of red on the carpet marked the place he had been lying on previously. She only hoped he hadn't gone through with his plan. But at least, Lee didn't seem to have noticed anything. If he was still trying to climb her, he was obviously having a hard time.

"Now, let's get the sign up so she can see it!" Cullen nodded and went to work. While Himako and Susan kept dragging the paper over the floor, he went to the other side and lifted the paper as far as he could. He only hoped it would be visible.
"This is it..." Himako mumbled, "Please notice us, Lee. We need help..."

Then, as they got closer, they saw...
13122.title: Himako's plan

choices: While Roxanne stomps through her house, she finally finds her maids!
Roxanne drops by the council to make her position known!
Roxanne goes to her meeting with the owners of the shopping mall!
Roxanne goes to the beach - maybe stumbeling over some intruders!
There was something else, that needed doing...
14.content:
Roxanne was angry. Her morning had been horrible. She had gotten up, bathed, got dressed, but when it was time to turn on her TV - an enromous LCD screen built into her living room wal - all she had gotten, was static! Obviously, it was broken. Now, she could just buy another one - twenty thousand dollars weren't exactly a big deal to her - but she hated to wait for her stuff to get fixed.
Pouting, she went downstairs into the large eating room of her spacious apartment, just to see that breakfeast hadn't been done! The table was completely empty. Now, few things got Roxanne as riled up as missing out on breakfeast, but what really made her seeth was that her maids had not even left a note explaining themselves!
On further examination, none of the cleaning had been done. Dust covered all the precious surfaces in her home. Pillows she had been lying on yesterday hadn't been puffed back up. Books and magazines littered the extravagant coffee table. What was she even paying her staff for!?

Roxanne stomped through her apartment, determined to give her servants a tongue lashing. But no one was there - which was even worse. They were meant to tell her, when they went out. She wasn't a slave driver, after all, though it felt like it to her servants. She was more than willing to let them have some vacation time. They just needed to ask first - now that they had taken off without a word, she was tempted to fire them all on the spot.

But even after a few minutes, nothing was stirring in her house except for herself. Her servants were simply impossible to find.
Roxanne sighed. She would have to swallow her anger for now, at least until she had someone to shout at. There were still other things, she could do today.

First of all, she coud have a meeting with the city council. Not that she had an appointment she needed to honor. Roxanne never made appointments. Rather, the council had adapted to her habit of dropping in every now and again, to make sure they didn't try anything smart behind her back. Like the thing with the land-owning-tax increase. She had threatened to move every last bit of her money out of the city, should they go through with it. That got them back in line, quick. Even though they didn't want to admit it - it was Roxanne who truly held the power in this city. Her wealth kept it running, her empire kept the people employed, and her money kept it from decaying. Her word was as good as law. She should make that known once more.

But an empire didn't build itself. Which meant that she had an actual meeting sometime today. Though she didn't care all that much about the business site of her wealth, she knew that she should at least check in sometime. When she did, she had noticed that a little competition had sprung up, hoping to escape her gaze. Some clothing chain had opened a large shopping center in the city, trying to vie for her customers. That couldn't be left standing - so she decided to buy the entire chain. The meeting with the owners would go over smoothely - they always did.
Not that they were actual competition. Roxanne just couldn't stand having a building in the city that didn't have her name on it.

But she may just take the day to relax. It was warm out, the height of summer - and luckily, she had her own private beach resort not all that far away. It was builld right next to a public beach, which kind of annoyed her - but the conditions she'd have to meet should she buy the entire beach sounded simply annoying. She had enough tourism agencies already, anyway.
Every now and then, some daring kids tried to sneak into the resort. They never got in very far, and if they did, they would be promply thrown out. She just hoped, that no one would bother her during her relaxation...
14.title: Roxanne, the cruel billionaire!

info.brief_description: On that fateful day, everybody shrinks... except...!
info.description:
Last night, a terrible flash engulfed the earth and when we woke up, we discovered that every single person in the world has shrunken down to mere inches. None of us know what happened - and we doubt, that we will ever find out. Now, that our houses, are technology, everything is to large for us, we struggle to survive.

But not everyone has been affected. This morning, someone simply wakes up in their bed, wondering where everybody has gone. The last normal sized human on earth - now, a giant. When they find out, what will they do?

You can be humanity's salvation. You can be it's destruction. Or it's new, ultimate ruler.
Choose wisely.
